Reasoning: **Analyzing tarot usage in Balatro**

I'm thinking about how the tarot cards work in the shop. It seems like you can specify cards from your deck, but the current hand is not shown. This makes it tricky since I can't target any cards without that hand displayed. The Hanged Man card could be useful, but it requires targets, and since none appear, I might need to wait until the hand is visible before using it. It's all a bit confusing with the interface!
**Considering tarot card mechanics**

I’m thinking about how tarot cards are typically used in a shop by selecting them from the deck view. We need hand positions to proceed, but that’s not currently possible. An alternative could be selling consumables for cash, but would that be truly helpful? Tarots can generally only be used in the shop, so if I can’t use them later, selling might be worth considering. Maybe there’s a hidden hand, and I can use cards without specifying targets? I'll need to figure this out before proceeding.
**Analyzing card strategies**

I'm considering how to effectively use our cards with the API's mechanics. We can have a flush with five cards while holding two. Steel cards boost our multipliers when held, and Chariot can enhance a card into steel, which sounds good! The challenge is knowing our hand to make informed choices. We might need to sell consumables before moving to the round. The Hanged Man could help improve our flush by removing non-matching cards, so I'll want to keep using these when possible, even if our hand isn’t visible!
**Considering card strategies and actions**

I'm thinking about using Chariot on a high-value diamond chip card, like the King of Diamonds. I remember that earlier, when opening a pack, the displayed hand included the King, Jack (which is steel), and 9 of Diamonds. If that was our hand, it might still be in the shop even if it’s not displayed now. This leads me to believe it may not be possible to specify. I should focus on proceeding to the next round for payouts, and perhaps arrange the jokers for optimal activation since their order can really influence the game dynamics!

# Available Commands
The possible commands in Balatro are all composed of a single word specifying the action, followed by any necessary positional arguments, which are lists of integers.
Note: all position arguments are 1-indexed.

The following commands are available in your current game state.
use_consumable <consumeable_position> <target_card_position1> <target_card_position2> ... <target_card_positionN> - Use a consumeable from the consumeables section. The first position argument is the position within your consumables inventory of the consumable you'd like to use. Subsequent position arguments specify the cards in hand that the consumeable will be used on, if that consumeable requires targets.
sell_consumable <consumeable_position> - Sell a consumeable from the consumeables section.
rearrange_jokers <joker1> <joker2> ... <jokerN> - Rearrange the list of currently owned jokers. Every index in the list of current jokers must be present, i.e. if there are 5 jokers, the indices 1-5 must be present.
sell_joker <joker_position> - Sell a joker from the jokers section.
play <card1> <card2> ... <card5> - Play the selected cards and draw new ones from the deck. You may play up to 5 cards at a time. If you play a hand, you must also respond with the intended hand type you think you are playing, and an estimate of the number of chips you think you will earn from the hand. Use the results of previous hands played to inform your estimate.
discard <card1> <card2> ... <card5> - Discard the selected cards and draw new ones from the deck. You may discard up to 5 cards at a time.
rearrange_hand <card1> <card2> ... <cardN> - Rearrange the hand of cards. Every index in the list of current cards must be present, i.e. if there are 5 cards, the indices 1-5 must be present.
